H0.text: Opened in 1637, in which city was the first public opera house. Rome

H1.text: Opened in 1637, in which city was the first public opera house. Florence

H2.text: Opened in 1637, in which city was the first public opera house. Naples

H3.text: Opened in 1637, in which city was the first public opera house. Venice

A4.text: The Teatro San Cassiano (or Teatro di San Cassiano and other variants) was the world's first public opera house, inaugurated as such in 1637 in Venice.
